FBAR penalties are asserted under Title 31 as a non-tax debt and do not appear on IDRS. They are tracked on a separate database at Detroit and that is where payments are posted and notices generated.

FBAR penalties cannot be included on an Offer in Compromise. The Bureau of Fiscal Service (BFS), formerly Financial Management Service (FMS), which is a bureau of the Department of the Treasury, is responsible collecting all non-tax debts. This includes FBAR penalties. Advise all taxpayers who have questions or need to pay an FBAR penalty to write to: Internal Revenue Service Detroit Federal Building P.O. Box
Detroit, MI
Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) is a statute written subsequent to the FBAR statute. Some taxpayers who file FBAR forms have a further re- quirement to file Form
, Statement of Specified Foreign Financial if they have specified foreign financial assets with an aggregate value exceeding $
on the last day of the tax year or $
at any time during the tax year, with higher thresholds for married individuals filing jointly and individuals living abroad. The Form

filing requirement does not replace or otherwise affect a tax- payer’s obligation to file an FBAR form. Individuals must file each form for which they meet the relevant reporting threshold. See IRM Exhibit
a comparison of these two foreign account reporting requirements. Use IDRS command code RTVUE to view if a taxpayer filed Form
The “CC CD” indicator (or Computer Condition Code) will include an “H ” to that Form
was filed. If Form
has been filed, ESTAB the return to view the return information. This may lead to the identification of a foreign asset or account.
